Title: Magusto Festival
Content:
Magusto festival: Celebrating the Portuguese culture, with a day of festivities, fun, and laughter.

This past weekend, Lar Santa Isabel hosted its beloved annual ‘Magusto’ Portuguese Chestnut Festival, bringing together our community for a celebration filled with tradition, music, and camaraderie. Despite a slow start on Saturday due to the cloudy weather, the festival quickly gained momentum, welcoming a steady flow of visitors eager to partake in the festivities. By early afternoon, our eating area was bustling with guests enjoying the warmth of roasted chestnuts and the joyous atmosphere.

A highlight of this year’s Magusto was the presence of the Portuguese Consul General, who attended as our guest of honor. Her participation added a special touch to the event, further reinforcing the strong cultural ties within our community. Even she and her partner could not resist the call of the music, joining in on the dancing and showcasing their impressive moves.

Roasting chestnuts is both an art and a tradition, and it was a sight to behold throughout the weekend. Our team carefully prepared the chestnuts by scoring each one to allow the heat to work its magic. They were then placed over open flames in large roasting drums, constantly turned to ensure an even roast. The crackling sounds, combined with the rich, earthy aroma, created an irresistible allure. As the shells blackened and split open, revealing the golden, smoky-sweet nut inside, visitors eagerly lined up to grab a warm paper cone filled with this seasonal delight.

Over the course of the weekend, we roasted an astounding 250kg of chestnuts, many of which were purchased by first-time tasters eager to experience this cherished Portuguese tradition. The aroma of the roasting chestnuts filled the air, adding to the festive ambiance that kept visitors coming back for more. Sunday saw an even greater turnout, with a large number of attendees arriving from mid-morning and staying well into the evening.

One of the most heartwarming aspects of this year’s festival was witnessing the generations come together. Some of our cherished residents were joined by their children, grandchildren, and even one or two great-grandchildren. Seeing families gathered around tables, sharing stories, laughter, and roasted chestnuts was a beautiful reminder of the deep-rooted connections that events like Magusto help nurture. These moments of togetherness highlight the importance of community, where traditions are passed down, and love spans generations.

As always, the live music was a crowd favorite. It was heartwarming to see guests of all ages coming together, moving tables and chairs to create a makeshift dance floor. The sounds of traditional Portuguese melodies filled the space, inspiring impromptu dance sessions and lively conversations. The energy was infectious, and it was a reminder of the power of music to unite people.

Fundraisers like Magusto are more than just events; they are a lifeline for organizations like Lar Santa Isabel. The funds raised go directly toward supporting our mission, ensuring that we can continue providing essential care and services to those who need it most. These gatherings not only help financially but also strengthen our sense of community, bringing people together in support of a common cause.

Lar Santa Isabel is more than just a home for the aged, it is a place filled with warmth, care, and a true sense of belonging. Our dedicated staff work tirelessly to provide a nurturing environment where residents feel valued and loved. Whether through daily activities, compassionate care, or events like Magusto, we strive to create a home that brings joy and dignity to our residents. If you or a loved one are considering a caring community that feels like family, we invite you to visit Lar Santa Isabel and experience the heart of our mission firsthand.

While our fundraising efforts were slightly down compared to last year, largely due to the unpredictable weather, we are immensely grateful for the unwavering support of our community. Every contribution, whether through ticket sales, food purchases, or donations, plays a crucial role in keeping our home running and improving the lives of our residents. It is through the generosity of our supporters that we can continue making a difference.

We extend our heartfelt thanks to everyone who attended, volunteered, and supported the event in any way. Your generosity and enthusiasm made this year’s Magusto a success despite the challenges. Fundraisers like these remind us that every effort, no matter how big or small, contributes to a greater good.

We wish each of you a blessed year ahead and look forward to welcoming you back next year for another unforgettable celebration. Until then, thank you for being part of our Lar Santa Isabel family!

Title: Edvilges Rodrigues (Eddie) - A Life of Resilience and Independence
Content:
Surviving Against the Odds

Eddie Rodrigues has faced many challenges in life, but she has always found a way to carry on with strength and independence. She comes from a small family and, over the years, has lost the few loved ones she had. Her husband, an only child, passed away in 1991. Her only sister died about 15 years ago, leaving no children behind.

She has a son who holds a degree in architecture, but unfortunately, he has cut all ties with her. She does not know where he lives or if he is well. Due to the difficulties in finding stable employment in his field, he was often unemployed. They lived together until he left South Africa at the end of 2018.

Eddie was employed full-time until 2004 when the company she worked for closed down. Due to her age, she was only able to find temporary jobs thereafter. Now, she is entirely dependent on the SASSA old age pension for her daily needs.

She was accepted at Lar Santa Isabel thanks to the intervention of her old and dear friend, Margarida Freire. Margarida, who was living in one of the Lar’s houses, recognized Eddie’s difficult situation and approached the board on her behalf. Thanks to this act of kindness, Eddie found a safe and caring home at Lar Santa Isabel.

Eddie would greatly appreciate a laptop, as hers is no longer working. She is open to receiving a second-hand or refurbished device if a new one is not possible. Any assistance in fulfilling this request would mean the world to her.
For more information, kindly enquire at welfare@larstisabel.co.za.

Help Eddie Stay Connected with a Laptop!

Eddie has faced many hardships but remains resilient. She would love to have a laptop, as hers has stopped working. A second-hand device would be just as appreciated as a new one! If you can assist, please contact welfare@larstisabel.co.za.

Title: Ricardo Folgosa - One Illness Changed His Life
Content:
One Illness Changed His Life

Ricardo Folgosa is a resident of Lar Rainha Santa Isabel and a cherished member of our community. His life took an unexpected turn when he lost his job due to a severe, life-threatening illness. The physical and emotional toll was overwhelming, but on August 13th, he was referred to the Lar by Dr. Garçes and Dr. Joâo Branco , marking the beginning of a transformative journey.

At the Lar, Ricardo received compassionate and professional care from Fatima Curado and the dedicated staff. The support he found, from medical attention to emotional encouragement, made the Lar a sanctuary during one of the darkest periods of his life. Slowly but surely, Ricardo began to recover, regaining both strength and hope.

After three to four months of rest and rehabilitation, Ricardo was ready to take the next step in life. Nelson Reis, a board member at the Lar, presented him with an opportunity to work at the Lar. Ricardo eagerly accepted, feeling deep gratitude for the care he had received and a strong desire to give back to the community. Contributing to the Lar while rebuilding his life proved incredibly motivating for him, providing renewed purpose and fulfilment.

Ricardo has also requested a donation of a pair of new Parrabellum shoes (size 9) to support his ongoing needs. For more information, kindly enquire at welfare@larstisabel.co.za.

Second Chance. One Simple Need.

After overcoming life-threatening challenges, Ricardo has found purpose and fulfillment within our community. He is currently in need of a a pair of new Parabellum shoes (size 9)  to improve his comfort. If you’d like to assist, please reach out to welfare@larstisabel.co.za.

Title: A Day of Joy and Glamour at Lar Rainha Santa Isabel
Content:
There are days that stay with you long after they’ve passed, and our recent pamper session at Lar Rainha Santa Isabel was one of those truly unforgettable moments. What started as a simple idea, to bring a little luxury and laughter to our beloved seniors, blossomed into a day filled with love, pride, and the kind of joy that makes the heart swell.

This wasn’t just an activity or a time-filler on the calendar. It was something much more meaningful. It was a moment for our residents to be honoured, celebrated, and reminded of their enduring beauty and worth. These sessions are about connection, tenderness, and recognition, the kind of recognition that says, You still matter. You are still radiant. You are still you.

A Celebration of Life, Laughter, and Self-Care

From the moment I arrived, the energy in the room was electric. You could feel it in the air, something special was about to unfold. It wasn’t just about painted nails or smoothed beards, it was about dignity, about touch, about being seen and celebrated. The room radiated happiness. Laughter echoed down the corridors, and the kind of conversations you only have when hearts are open and free flowed like tea on a winter afternoon.

Many of our residents came in slowly, some with the help of caregivers, others with walkers or wheelchairs, but all with curious smiles and eyes full of anticipation. These may seem like small things to those of us caught up in the hustle and bustle of daily life, but to them, it meant everything.

Manicures and pedicures became moments of connection. Foot massages turned into stories being shared, of youth, of love, of adventure, and even of loss. Beards were gently shaved as smiles formed on faces weathered by time. There was a sense of peace in the room, an unspoken understanding that this day was special, that they were being honoured for all they’ve lived through.

Oxygen masks, walking aids, and the many visible markers of long, full lives faded into the background as the real magic took center stage, each resident feeling, even if just for a moment, as if the years had melted away. We watched as eyes lit up, as shoulders relaxed, and as laughter bubbled up with each passing moment of pampering.

Beauty Knows No Age

And oh, how radiant they looked! That "look good, feel good" glow was undeniable. We saw it in every smile, every glance in the mirror, and every bashful comment about being “too old” for pink polish, followed by an excited, “Why not? Let’s do it!” Even those well into their 90's, sand one proud soul at the grand age of 100!, found themselves giggling with excitement, admiring freshly painted nails or the smoothness of a clean shave.

Who says beauty fades with age? At Lar Rainha Santa Isabel, we saw with our own eyes that it doesn’t. If anything, it deepens, shines brighter, and carries a grace only time can give. There’s a kind of beauty that comes with wisdom, with experience, with having faced life’s storms and still standing tall. That’s the kind of beauty we saw, raw, unfiltered, and deeply moving.

And let’s not forget the pride. Oh, the pride on their faces! As if each touch of polish, each careful massage, each act of kindness reminded them of who they are beneath the wrinkles and the wear. The beauty treatments were a means, but the end was joy, confidence, and that unmistakable twinkle of self-love.

A Heartfelt Thank You

To the Board of Lar Rainha Santa Isabel, thank you for placing your trust in us as volunteers to create these special moments. Your faith in our vision gave us the freedom to truly connect, care, and serve. The trust you extend to us doesn’t go unnoticed, and we carry that responsibility with great honour and care.

To the amazing woman who stands beside me through it all, Lorena Umba, your heart, strength, and compassion inspire me every time. Thank you for being my partner in crime. You’ve been there every step of the way, pouring yourself into this with the same love and energy that has always set you apart. Your presence alone calms the room, lifts the mood, and makes everything possible.

And our wonderful team of cargivers who offered their hands and hearts so generously, thank you for your warmth, patience, and unwavering enthusiasm. Each of you brought something beautiful and irreplaceable to the day. Whether it was a gentle hand, a kind word, or a shared laugh, your contribution turned a simple event into a soul-nourishing experience.

A very personal thank you to Dona Aida, who insisted on painting my nails herself! That small, gentle gesture reminded me once again that caring goes both ways, and that our seniors still have so much to give. It was such a tender and unexpected moment, and it truly moved me. It’s those kinds of exchanges that make these days so special, not just giving care, but receiving it, too.

And of course, our sincere gratitude to Fatima Teixeira, Candy Da Silva (Nucleo), Paula De Sousa, Adelaide Vilela, Celia Lopes and Mary Ann Da Silva for generously donating the nail polish and other products for the pamper session. Your contribution added a splash of colour and sparkle that lit up every corner of the room. These donations may seem like small gestures on the surface, but they made a world of difference. Every bottle of polish, every gentle lotion helped create magic.

Until the Next Pamper session

This was more than just a pamper session. It was a revival of spirit, a celebration of self-worth, and a reminder that it’s never too late to feel beautiful. It was a tribute to the resilience, humour, and grace of our elders. It was a space where time paused, where joy was centre stage, and where love, pure, simple love, was in every corner.

What I experienced was nothing short of healing. Not just for the residents, but for me too. It reminded me why I do what I do. It brought me back to the heart of service: to connect, to uplift, and to share in the human experience.

I honestly can’t wait for the next one. Because if there’s one thing I saw clearly, it’s that joy doesn’t age, and kindness never goes out of style.

With love and gratitude,

Please help us keep these moments, ongoing.

A donation of even one nail varnish remover or a file will ensure we keep the pampering on going

Contact us to assist

Title: Domingos Pinheiro - From Service to Simple Need
Content:
From Service to Simple Need

Mr Domingos Pinheiro is a resident of Lar Rainha Santa Isabel. He is affectionately known as “Domingos” and is a valued member of our Portuguese Community.

Domingos' life has been shaped by numerous profound challenges. At the age of 34, he endured the devastating loss of his wife. Not long after, tragedy struck again when his 17-year-old daughter passed away, leaving him grappling with unimaginable grief. These losses carved an irreplaceable void in his life and made the future feel deeply uncertain.

Adding to these hardships, Domingos later suffered a stroke that left him hospitalized for six long months. The road to recovery was arduous, both physically and emotionally, as his world seemed to come to a halt. It was during this difficult time that Nelson Reis introduced him to the Lar, a place that would come to play a pivotal role in his healing journey. Domingos arrived at the Lar in August 2009.

The Lar proved to be a sanctuary of recovery and purpose for Domingos. Within its welcoming community, he slowly regained his physical and mental strength. As his health improved, Domingos began contributing to the Lar by helping with maintenance, daily tasks, and offering support to fellow residents. These contributions provided him with a renewed sense of pride and purpose, allowing him to feel part of a meaningful community once more.

For several years, Domingos dedicated himself wholeheartedly to the Lar and its residents. However, with the departures of Fatima, Sandra, and Nelson, his services were no longer required. Despite this, he remains deeply grateful for the care and support the Lar offered him during his most challenging times.

Domingos has requested a donation of a new 3/4 bed for his room to improve his comfort and living conditions. For more information, kindly enquire at welfare@larstisabel.co.za.

While the pain of his past remains a part of him, Domingos continues to draw strength and hope from the community that gave him a second chance. The Lar not only helped him heal but also became a source of gratitude and a new beginning.

After Loss, Just One Request.

His journey of resilience, healing, and gratitude is an inspiration to us all. Domingos has requested a donation of a new 3/4 bed and mattress to support his ongoing needs. Want to help? Reach out to welfare@larstisabel.co.za.

Title: Physical Activity for Healthy Aging: Keeping Seniors Active & Happy
Content:
As we grow older, staying active isn’t just a nice-to-have, it’s essential. Physical activity for healthy aging plays a vital role in maintaining independence, mobility, and mental well-being in later years. At Lar Santa Isabel, we believe movement should be joyful, accessible, and part of everyday life for our residents. Through fun and engaging programs, we help our seniors move their bodies, lift their spirits, and reclaim their vitality.

Common Barriers to Senior Physical Activity (And How We Overcome Them)

As we grow older, staying active isn’t just a nice-to-have, it’s essential. Physical activity for healthy aging plays a vital role in maintaining independence, mobility, and mental well-being in later years. At Lar Santa Isabel, we believe movement should be joyful, accessible, and part of everyday life for our residents.

While we currently offer gentle light aerobics and stretching, we’re excited to launch a more diverse fitness and games program, but we need your help to make it possible.

Why Physical Activity Is Important in Old Age

Just like a car needs a regular drive to keep the engine running smoothly, our bodies need consistent movement to stay in working order. Physical activity improves circulation, strengthens muscles, supports balance, and helps prevent age-related diseases. For older adults, staying active also plays a key role in maintaining independence and emotional health.
Movement gives our residents a reason to smile, socialize, and stay mentally sharp, far beyond physical benefits.

Current Activities & Our Vision for the Future

At present, we offer light aerobics and guided stretching sessions, gentle, low-impact routines that our residents enjoy and benefit from. But we dream of doing more.

With your support, we hope to introduce:

Chair and Mat Yoga – to improve flexibility and reduce stress
Mini Golf – a fun and social game that supports hand-eye coordination
Lawn Bowls – perfect for building balance and gently increasing activity
Memory & Movement Games – combining cognitive stimulation with physical play
Gentle Strength Training – using light weights and resistance bands

These activities are not just fun, they’re powerful tools for improving quality of life.

What’s Holding Us Back? A Lack of Equipment

Our biggest challenge is access to equipment and resources. To make this program a reality, we urgently need:

Mini golf set (putters, balls, mats)
Lawn bowls set
Mini Games
Yoga mats for light stretching

These aren’t luxuries, they’re keys to unlocking better mobility, stronger bodies, and happier hearts for our residents.

This is where you can make a difference.

A donation of even one yoga mat or a single mini-golf kit can change lives.

Contact us to assist

Real-Life Impact: Small Steps, Big Smiles

One of our residents, who once relied entirely on her walker. Since joining our daily stretch group, she’s regained mobility, confidence, and a great sense of humor. She’s even offered to be the “referee” when mini golf arrives.

We want every resident to feel that same sense of empowerment and fun.

Our Commitment: Active Aging with Dignity

At Lar Santa Isabel, we don’t just care for the elderly—we celebrate them. Our staff is passionate about promoting movement in a way that’s gentle, engaging, and adapted to each person’s abilities.

We envision a home filled with laughter during game time, calm during yoga practice, and connection through shared movement. But we can’t do it alone.

How You Can Help

Sponsor a session. Donate a mat. Fund a game.
Every contribution helps us:

  • Launch our expanded fitness and activity program
  • Purchase the necessary equipment
  • Offer new weekly classes and games
  • Involve physiotherapists and movement specialists
  • Create a safe, uplifting space for active aging
Whether you're an individual, local business, or organization, your support can directly impact the lives of seniors who deserve the best in their golden years.

Ready to help?

Physical activity is more than a health booster, it’s a source of joy, dignity, and connection for our seniors. With your help, we can turn our vision of a improved wellness program into a reality.

Reach Out

Sponsor a smile. Fund a fitness dream. Help us keep our seniors active, healthy, and happy.

Title: A Day of Laughter, Movement, and Memory at Lar Rainha Santa Isabel
Content:
At Lar Rainha Santa Isabel, we always look forward to the special visits from our friends Candy and Rosa from Núcleo. The energy in the home shifts the moment they walk through the doors, it’s as if a fresh breeze blows in, bringing with it laughter, music, new games, and a whole lot of joy.

When Candy and Rosa arrive, our residents instantly light up. Their faces brighten, their posture straightens, and the whole room buzzes with excitement. There’s something magical about seeing new faces, especially ones so full of warmth and enthusiasm. It’s not just the activities they bring, but the spirit in which they bring them. These two don’t just "run a session"; they engage, connect, and uplift in a way that leaves a lasting impact.

Games That Bring More Than Just Fun

Every visit includes something different, which keeps things fresh and exciting. On this particular day, Candy and Rosa came prepared with a mix of classic games, brain teasers, and movement-based activities that had everyone joining in, whether clapping from their chairs or up on their feet. It’s not just about passing the time; their games are designed to stimulate memory, encourage gentle physical movement, and spark conversation.

One moment, the residents were stretching and tapping to the beat of a rhythmic game; the next, they were playing a memory challenge that brought back giggles, stories, and even a little healthy competition. These sessions are about so much more than just fun, they support cognitive health, improve mood, and help keep minds sharp in the most joyful way possible.

It’s truly something to witness. Even residents who may usually be a bit more reserved find themselves getting swept up in the energy, clapping along, or calling out answers to quiz games with surprising confidence.

Little Treats and Big Smiles

And then, of course, come the little surprises. Candy and Rosa never arrive empty-handed, they always bring something thoughtful to make the day feel extra special. Whether it’s a small sweet treat, a cheerful sticker, or a handmade keepsake, these little tokens bring big smiles.

A Boost for Body and Soul

What makes these visits so meaningful is how they touch every part of our residents’ well-being. Yes, there’s movement and memory work, but there’s also emotional nourishment. These activities remind our seniors that they are still capable, still creative, still full of life. That feeling of accomplishment, even from a simple game, is a powerful thing.

Their ability to engage, encourage, and uplift is truly a gift. They remind us that care is not just about meeting physical needs, it’s about feeding the soul, creating moments of joy, and bringing laughter to lives that have given so much

Until the Next Surprise Visit…

The residents at Lar Rainha Santa Isabel are always telling me how thankful they are for Candy and Rosa’s surprise visits, they really brighten up the day and bring a fun change to their usual routine.

With heartfelt thanks.
